What you see in this snippet is:
1. A compilation after rustc_llvm is already built. The bootstrap script attempts to build librustc next.
2. I change a source file for librustc_llvm;
3. On a first re-run of bootstrap script, the change is properly detected, but I cancel the build before librustc_llvm build completes;
4. On a 2nd re-run of the script, change to librustc_llvm is seemingly forgotten, and it attempts to build librustc as if librustc_llvm was already built, although the build was cancelled.

To successfully reproduce this issue it seems like it might be necessary to get timing of cancelling the build in step 3 just right. To reproduce this issue 2nd time it took me 2 or 3 attempts to do the step 3.
